title: Variable ocean.wppwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wppwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

title: Variable ocean.wppswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wppswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

title: Variable ocean.wpp.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wpp)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

title: Variable ocean.wpdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wpdirwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wpdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wpdirswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wpdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wpdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wdirwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wdirswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.wdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.thkcellvo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.thkcellvo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The time varying thickness of ocean cells centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
Long name: Ocean Model Cell Thickness at v-points
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.thkcelluo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.thkcelluo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The time varying thickness of ocean cells centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
Long name: Ocean Model Cell Thickness at u-points
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.swhwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.swhwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.swhswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.swhswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.

title: Variable ocean.swhmax.tpt-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.swhmax)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.swh.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.swh)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.sltbasin.tavg-u-hyb-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sltbasin)
Cell methods: depth: longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin) time: mean
Comment: Northward Ocean Salt Transport from all physical processes affecting northward salt transport, resolved and parameterized. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.

title: Variable ocean.sfy.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sfyint)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
Comment: Ocean salt mass y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
Long name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass Y Transport
Processing notes: 2d vertically integrated field. If the full 3d transport is preferred, produce Omon.sfy instead. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.sfy.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sfy)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
Processing notes: 3d field. If only the 2d vertically integrated transport is available or is preferred, produce Omon.sfyint instead. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.sfx.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sfxint)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
Comment: Ocean salt mass x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
Long name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass X Transport
Processing notes: 2d vertically integrated field. If the full 3d transport is preferred, produce Omon.sfx instead. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.sfx.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sfx)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
Processing notes: 3d field. If only the 2d vertically integrated transport is available or is preferred, produce Omon.sfxint instead. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.sfacrossline.tavg-u-ht-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sfacrossline)
Cell methods: depth: sum where sea time: mean
Comment: Depth-integrated total salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes across different lines on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al., 2016). Formally, this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the heat transport. Positive and negative numbers refer to total northward/eastward and southward/westward transports, respectively. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.
Long name: Ocean Salt Mass Transport across Lines

title: Variable ocean.sdvo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sdvo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The northward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

title: Variable ocean.sduo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.sduo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The eastward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

title: Variable ocean.scint.tavg-op4-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.scint)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where sea
Comment: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
Long name: Integral wrt depth of seawater practical salinity expressed as salt mass content
Processing notes: CHANGE: This is a new variable, which aids in understanding hydrological change. It is preferable to calculate it online, due to difficulties with vertical discretizations. It is calculated as an integral over hydrostatic pressure ranges, which makes it directly comparable with observations.

title: Variable ocean.phcint.tavg-op4-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.phcint)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where sea
Comment: This is the vertically-integrated heat content derived from potential temperature (thetao).
Long name: Integrated Ocean Heat Content from Potential Temperature
Processing notes: CHANGE: This is a new variable, which aids in calculation of energy budgets. It is preferable to calculate it online, due to difficulties with vertical discretizations. It is calculated as an integral over hydrostatic pressure ranges, which makes it directly comparable with observations so long as integrals are over 0-300m, 300m-700m, 700m-2000m, total depth.

title: Variable ocean.pfscint.tavg-op4-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.pfscint)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where sea
Comment: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
Long name: Integral wrt depth of seawater preformed salinity expressed as salt mass content
Processing notes: CHANGE: This is a new variable, which aids in understanding hydrological change. It is preferable to calculate it online, due to difficulties with vertical discretizations. It is calculated as an integral over hydrostatic pressure ranges, which makes it directly comparable with observations.

title: Variable ocean.mpwwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.mpwwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of wind-sea waves only (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.mpwswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.mpwswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of swell waves only (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.mpw.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.mpw)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.hfy.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.hfy)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_measures" was "area: areacello"; ; "dimensions" was "longitude latitude time"; ; "long_name" was "Ocean Heat Y Transport";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.
Processing notes: 3d field. If only the 2d vertically integrated transport is available or is preferred, produce Omon.hfyint instead. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.hfx.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.hfx)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_measures" was "area: areacello"; ; "long_name" was "Ocean Heat X Transport"; ; "comment" was "Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale."; ; "dimensions" was "longitude latitude time";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale
Processing notes: 3d field. If only the 2d vertically integrated transport is available or is preferred, produce Omon.hfxint instead. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.hfacrossline.tavg-u-ht-sea.mon.glb (Omon.hfacrossline)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
Comment: Depth-integrated total heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes across different lines on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al., 2016). Formally, this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the heat transport. Positive and negative numbers refer to total northward/eastward and southward/westward transports, respectively. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

title: Variable ocean.chcint.tavg-op4-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.chcint)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where sea
Comment: This is the vertically-integrated heat content derived from conservative temperature (bigthetao).
Long name: Depth Integrated Seawater Conservative Temperature Expressed As Heat Content
Processing notes: CHANGE: This is a new variable, which aids in calculation of energy budgets. It is preferable to calculate it online, due to difficulties with vertical discretizations. It is calculated as an integral over hydrostatic pressure ranges, which makes it directly comparable with observations so long as integrals are over 0-300m, 300m-700m, 700m-2000m, total depth.

title: Variable ocean.absscint.tavg-op4-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Omon.absscint)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where sea
Comment: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
Long name: Integral wrt depth of seawater absolute salinity expressed as salt mass content
Processing notes: CHANGE: This is a new variable, which aids in understanding hydrological change. It is preferable to calculate it online, due to difficulties with vertical discretizations. It is calculated as an integral over hydrostatic pressure ranges, which makes it directly comparable with observations.

title: Variable ocean.dyvo.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.glb (Ofx.dyvo)
Cell methods: area: point
Comment: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
Long name: Cell Length in the Y Direction at v-points

title: Variable ocean.dyuo.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.glb (Ofx.dyuo)
Cell methods: area: point
Comment: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
Long name: Cell Length in the Y Direction at u-points

title: Variable ocean.dyto.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.glb (Ofx.dyto)
Cell methods: area: point
Comment: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at t-points (points for tracers such as temperature, salinity, etc.). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
Long name: Cell Length in the Y Direction at t-points

title: Variable ocean.dxvo.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.glb (Ofx.dxvo)
Cell methods: area: point
Comment: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
Long name: Cell Length in the X Direction at v-points

title: Variable ocean.dxuo.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.glb (Ofx.dxuo)
Cell methods: area: point
Comment: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
Long name: Cell Length in the X Direction at u-points

title: Variable ocean.dxto.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.glb (Ofx.dxto)
Cell methods: area: point
Comment: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at t-points (points for tracers such as temperature, salinity, etc.). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
Long name: Cell Length in the X Direction at t-points

title: Variable ocean.opottemptend.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.dec.glb (Odec.opottemptend)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Long name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.zostoga.tavg-u-hm-sea.day.glb (Oday.zostoga)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
Long name: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello, zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)
Expression HadGEM3-GC5: calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello, zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)
Expression UKESM1: calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello, zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)
Expression UKESM1-3: calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello, zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)

title: Variable ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.zos)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: This is the effective dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. zos is the effective sea level as if sea ice (and snow) at a grid cell were converted to liquid seawater (Campin et al., 2008). For OMIP, do _not _record inverse barometer responses from sea-ice (and snow) loading in zos. See (Griffies et al, 2016, https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016).

title: Variable ocean.wo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.wo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

title: Variable ocean.vos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.vos)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Daily surface prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
Long name: Daily Surface Sea Water Y Velocity
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Surface values only.

title: Variable ocean.uos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.uos)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Daily surface prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
Long name: Daily Surface Sea Water X Velocity
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Surface values only.

title: Variable ocean.thetao.tavg-op20bar-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.thetao200)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Long name: Sea Water Potential Temperature at 200 meters
Processing notes: The variable at the depth of 200 meters is requested.

title: Variable ocean.so.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.so)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation.
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native

title: Variable ocean.rsdo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.rsdo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
Long name: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water

title: Variable ocean.hfy.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.hfyint)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
Comment: Ocean heat y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
Long name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat Y Transport
Processing notes: 2d vertically integrated field. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.hfx.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.hfxint)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
Comment: Ocean heat x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
Long name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat X Transport
Processing notes: 2d vertically integrated field. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.bigthetao.tavg-op20bar-hxy-sea.day.glb (Oday.bigthetao200)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Long name: Sea Water Conservative Temperature at 200 meters
Processing notes: The variable at the depth of 200 meters is requested.

title: Variable ocean.t17d.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.glb (Emon.t17d)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Monthly 17C isotherm depth
Processing notes: This quantity, sometimes called the "isotherm depth", is the depth (if it exists) at which the sea water potential temperature equals some specified value. This value should be specified in a scalar coordinate variable. Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.

title: Variable ocean.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-ifs.mon.glb (Emon.rsusoni)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
Comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell not covered by sea ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
Long name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ocean Not Covered by Sea Ice
Processing notes: other than the different rule for spatial averaging, the variable is equivalent to Amon.rsus

title: Variable ocean.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-ifs.mon.glb (Emon.rsdsoni)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
Comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell not covered by sea ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
Long name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ocean Not Covered by Sea Ice
Processing notes: other than the different rule for spatial averaging, the variable is equivalent to Amon.rsds

title: Variable ocean.wppwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wppwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

title: Variable ocean.wppswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wppswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

title: Variable ocean.wpdirwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wpdirwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wpdirswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wpdirswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wdirwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wdirwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wdirswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wdirswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.swhwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.swhwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.swhswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.swhswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.

title: Variable ocean.swhmax.tmax-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.swhmax)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: maximum
Comment: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.sdvo.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.sdvo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: The northward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

title: Variable ocean.sduo.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.sduo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: The eastward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

title: Variable ocean.mpwwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.mpwwindsea)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of wind-sea waves only (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.mpwswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.mpwswell)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of swell waves only (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.wpp.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wpp)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

title: Variable ocean.wpdir.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wpdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.wfo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.
Processing notes: Net flux of water into sea water, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

title: Variable ocean.wdir.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.wdir)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.tauvo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.tauvo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The stress on the liquid ocean from interactions with overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Long name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.tauuo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.tauuo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The stress on the liquid ocean from interactions with overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
Long name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.swh.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.swh)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.sfdsi.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.sfdsi)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Basal salt flux into ocean from sea ice. This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
Long name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.
Expression UKESM1-3: ((meltt + meltb + meltl - congel - frazil) * ICE_DENSITY + melts * SNOW_DENSITY) / (100. * SECONDS_IN_DAY * aice) * REF_SALINITY / 1000.

title: Variable ocean.rsntds.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.rsntds)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The radiative flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
Long name: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.mpw.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hrPt.mpw)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: point
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.hfrunoffds.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.hfrunoffds)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
Long name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Processing notes: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e., it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions). Include enough depth levels to represent the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

title: Variable ocean.hfds.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.hfds)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment').
Long name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

title: Variable ocean.friver.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.friver)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.flandice.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.flandice)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice

title: Variable ocean.ficeberg.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.3hr.glb (3hr.ficeberg)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.
